title: Analyze Your Findings Unit | Salesforce Trailhead

questions.title: 1What's the best way to lay out your data results spreadsheet according to the example shown?

answers.content: A Enter your responses any way you wish-layout actually makes little difference.
B List your users' names in the first column and your questions across the top row. Then enter the users' individual responses in each row.
D Put your questions in the top row and enter all the responses below, disregarding the users' names.

wrongAnswers.content: C Put your users' names in the top row and enter all their respective responses below.

correctAnswer.content: B List your users' names in the first column and your questions across the top row. Then enter the users' individual responses in each row.

questions.title: 2What should you do before you enter your results into a results spreadsheet?

answers.content: A Ensure that all the results have been transcribed accurately and make sense
B Make sure that there is only one sentiment expressed per person
D Ensure that only the answers which require further discussion are entered into the spreadsheet

wrongAnswers.content: C Ensure that only the positive answers from the more vocal participants are entered into the spreadsheet

correctAnswer.content: A Ensure that all the results have been transcribed accurately and make sense

questions.title: 3Which of the following are good things to look for when analyzing your results?

answers.content: B The differences in sentiments across the responses
D Sentiments (positive, negative, or unsure) across the responses, as well as trends, commonalities, and differences

wrongAnswers.content: C Only the positive and negative sentiments across the responses
A The commonalities across the responses

correctAnswer.content: D Sentiments (positive, negative, or unsure) across the responses, as well as trends, commonalities, and differences
